intro: Onosma fuyunensis, commonly known as the Fuyun sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Onosma fuyunensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
